Name: Candidate Overspending, Non-Participating
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York in relation to investigations by the campaign finance board with regard to overspending by a non-participating candidate.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:


	Section 1. Paragraph (3) of �3-706 of title 3 of the administrative code is hereby amended by adding a new subdivision (c) to read as follows:
	(c)  Upon the receipt of written allegations and supporting documents of overspending by a non-participating candidate, the campaign finance board shall initiate an independent investigation of each allegation.  The board shall complete its investigation within 10 days of receipt of the allegations.  During that period, the non-participating candidate shall have the opportunity to appear before the board and/or file with the board any written response to the allegations and any supporting documents.
	If upon review of the documents and the completion of its own investigation, the board finds that there is clear and convincing evidence of overspending by the non-participating candidate, the board shall issue a written decision to that effect before granting the requisite matching funds to the participating candidate.  The board's written decision shall include the actions the board took in verifying the allegations of overspending made against a non-participating candidate.  If at a date after additional matching funds have been granted to a participating candidate the board receives or discovers evidence proving that an allegation was false, the board shall seek reimbursement of any additional matching funds given to such candidate based on such false allegation.
	�2.	This local law shall take effect immediately.
